the protuberances of the cells; a portion of the interior, as

tercellular partitions, in alternate zones; and another pos-
tion <u>f,f</u>, as displayed by a fracture in the course of one of the zones,
laying open the entrances to the cells from <s>the</s> its inner or central
side. <s>of the zone</s>.
2. Horizontal section of a small disk, showing the actual
disposition of the central cell, <u>a</u>, the circumambient cell, <u>b,b</u>, the
cells of the concentric annuli, <u>c,c,c</u>,  and the marginal pores
<u>d,d</u>:- 90 diam.
